    Frequently Asked Questions

    Welcome to the Junk Store Decky Plugin FAQ! Here youâ€™ll find answers to the most commonly asked questions about the Junk Store Decky plugin. This page is updated regularly as we respond to user feedback and questions.

    If you still canâ€™t find what youâ€™re looking for, visit our Plugin Troubleshooting, Epic Troubleshooting, or GOG Troubleshooting pages.

    For more help, drop by the r/JunkStore subreddit or join us on Discord.

    General

    Why won't my game launch?

    Games may fail to launch for a variety of reasons. Here are some common causes and what you can do:

    • Wrong compatibility layer:
      Try switching to a different version of Proton. Non-Steam games usually work best with GE-Proton. We recommend finding a version that works well for most of your library and using it as the default for non-Steam games.

      However, some titles require a specific version of Proton or GE-Proton to run properly.
    • Missing dependencies:
      Some games require additional libraries such as Microsoft C++ Runtime or DirectX. These dependencies may not always trigger an obvious error message, so try installing them if you suspect theyâ€™re missing.
    • Check ProtonDB:
      If the game still wonâ€™t launch, visit ProtonDB.com for community tips. You may find game-specific tweaks, compatibility reports, or Proton version recommendations that solve your issue.
    Whatâ€™s the difference between the Decky version and the Paid version

    The Decky version is free and open source, designed to run via the Decky Loader. The Paid version includes extra convenience features and doesn't require Decky to run. For more help, see our GOG Troubleshooting Guide

    Is Junk-Store trustworthy?

    Yes. Junk Store is developed by a cybersecurity expert and white-hat professional. You can verify our lead developerâ€™s credentials on LinkedIn.

    Does Junk Store store any of my credentials?

    No. Junk Store does not store any of your credentials. All authentication is handled via OAuth tokens. The only token managed directly by Junk Store is the Junk Store token. Other tokens are managed by external tools: Legendary (Epic) & lgogdownloader (Gog).

    How do I report a bug?

    We really appreciate bug reports!

    Please submit them on GitHub so we can track them:
    ðŸ‘‰ Submit a bug report

    Note: Bug reports arenâ€™t support tickets. For help, reach out on Discord.

    How do I submit a feature request?

    We prefer feature requests via GitHub where they can be tracked:
    ðŸ‘‰ Submit a feature request

    Requests submitted this way are reviewed first.

    I want X feature. Can you add it?

    There are a few ways to request features:

    1. Submit a pull request if you know how to code.
    2. Offer a bounty and pay a developer to implement it.

    Using Junk Store

    Does Junk Store support cloud saves
    • No, as we don't want to have users run the risk of losing their game saves.
    How do I change where games are downloaded?

    Go to the settings (gear icon) under the Epic tab and set your preferred download location. If you're using an SD card, point the path to your SD card directory.

    Don't forget to press X to save your changes.

    Can I move games to my SD card?

    Not at the moment. Itâ€™s a complex feature and on our development roadmap. For now, games need to be stored on internal storage or an already-mounted drive.

    How do I install or uninstall a game?

    To uninstall a game:

    1. Open the game page in Junk-Store.
    2. Select the slider menu and choose Uninstall.
    3. Locate and manually delete any leftover files:
      • For Epic: ~/Games/epic or /*microsd*/Games/epic
      • For GOG: ~/Games/gog or /*microsd*/Games/gog
    How do I find save data for my games?
    1. Find the Steam ID at the bottom of the game page in Junk-Store.
    2. Navigate to: ~/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/compatdata/*SteamID*/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/
    3. From here, follow the game's path:
      • Example (Epic): .../local settings/application data/Dying Light/Saved
      • Example (GOG): .../AppData/Roaming/Lonely Troops/Hero of the Kingdom II
    How do I change the Proton version for a game?

    You can change the Proton version from either your Steam Library or directly in Junk-Store:

    • In Junk-Store:
      1. Press Y to open the Steam shortcut.
      2. Click the gear icon â†’ Properties â†’ Compatibility, then select your desired Proton version.
      3. Relaunch the game.
    • In Steam Library:
      1. Highlight the game in your library.
      2. Press the Start/Options button (three lines).
      3. Go to Properties â†’ Compatibility, then choose your Proton version.
      4. Relaunch the game.

    Once your Proton version is set, back out to the game screen and press Play.

    Can I use Junk-Store with games I already installed using Heroic or Lutris?

    No, Junk-Store manages its own game installs. If you want to manage those games, youâ€™ll need to install them again via Junk-Store.

    Does CheatDeck work with Junk-Store?

    Not reliably. Epic game launch options are very sensitive, and tools like CheatDeck can conflict with Junk-Storeâ€™s configuration. Weâ€™ve spent over 100 hours fine-tuning this â€” so use with caution. That said, our extension scripts are open and easier to modify than the plugin core. If you want to experiment and send a working pull request, weâ€™re happy to review it!

    Game Compatibility & Support

    I canâ€™t get EA or Ubisoft games to work through Epic. Why not?

    These games aren't supported yet. They rely on additional launchers (EA and Ubisoft), which haven't been integrated. We're focused on other features for now, but pull requests are welcome if youâ€™d like to contribute.

    Does the GOG extension support DOS and ScummVM games?

    No. DOS and some ScummVM titles are not currently supported.

    Can I play Fortnite via Junk Store?

    No. Epic Games does not support Fortnite on Linux due to anti-cheat limitations.

    To play Fortnite on a Steam Deck or Linux system, you will need to either:

    • Dual-boot Windows
    • Use a cloud gaming or streaming service

    More info: The Verge article

    Can I play Kingdom Hearts via Junk Store?

    This title hasnâ€™t been officially tested and is known to have compatibility issues unrelated to Junk Store. If you're keen to give it a shot, check the Legendary README for possible workarounds and notes.

    Do games that require third-party launchers work?

    Not currently. While Legendary has limited support, this feature isnâ€™t implemented in Junk-Store yet. You can attempt manual setup via CLI or modify the extension script.

    Do EA and Ubisoft games work via Junk Store?

    EA Games:
    No, EA games are not supported. They require the EA Launcher, which isnâ€™t integrated with Junk Store. Because of this, EA titles will not appear in your Epic Games library when accessed through Junk Store.

    Ubisoft Games:
    Itâ€™s complicated. Some Ubisoft titles do appear in your Epic library, while others donâ€™t. The Ubisoft Launcher is not officially supported, but weâ€”and some usersâ€”have successfully installed it manually and run select games through Junk Store.

    • A full guide is available here: How to install Ubisoft via Junk Store
